nodes.description: Stream audio and video into your Gabber flow
Controls the frame rate of the video being processed
Slides a window of media and writes based on input trigger.
Creates new context messages with specified role and content
Stores and manages conversation context messages
Manages conversation context for language models
Send and receive responses from any OpenAI-compatible language model
Automatically converts data between compatible types
Converts text to speech using Gabber's native TTS model
Outputs audio and video to the end user

value.value:
# Adding Video
### In this example, we are doing the exact same thing, but we've added another modality - video!

### With this addition, you can bring in real-time video or stream your screen.

nodes.description: A comment node for adding notes and documentation to your graph

value.value: ### - `FPS`: Throttles our streamed in video to a specified frame rate. In this case we have it set to 1 frame every 2 seconds.

nodes.description: A comment node for adding notes and documentation to your graph

value.value: ### - `Sliding Window`: Only maintains the last X seconds of media. We use this to only send in the most recent clip into our LLM context. We "flush" our sliding window using our VAD models "speaking_ended_trigger"

nodes.description: A comment node for adding notes and documentation to your graph

value.value: ### Zip together our audio and video into a single media clip and create a context message from that media clip.

nodes.description: A comment node for adding notes and documentation to your graph
